Legal_Issue: Whether credibility findings were supported by evidence
Credibility_Assessment: Multiple inconsistencies between testimony and Personal Information Forms (PIFs)
Evidence_Type: Personal Information Forms (PIFs), medical reports, testimonial evidence
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution by Shalva Nozadze in Georgia
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection claim and subsequent judicial review
Application_Error: Omission of material details (e.g., bribes to police), contradictory information
Review_Outcome: No question of general importance certified; application dismissed
Legal_Standard: Subjective and objective components of refugee status; burden of proof on applicant
Application_Factor: Credibility, corroboration, consistency across documents and testimony
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed due to lack of credible evidence
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA sections related to refugee determination and credibility assessment
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility, uncorroborated claims, inconsistencies in testimony and documentation
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections 96, 97, and relevant provisions on credibility under IRPA
Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictory medical reports, unnamed individuals, omitted events
Procedural_Fairness: Board properly considered documentary evidence and testimony
Document_Fraud: Potential misrepresentation in forms (e.g., naming different individuals in medical reports)
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistent accounts of events, omissions of key details
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board’s credibility findings
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada - Federal Court review of immigration decision
Procedural_Issue: Treatment of documentary evidence and burden of proof
Omission_Type: Failure to disclose bribes, inconsistent personal history details
